HomePage.about: This is an amazing platform that helps you achieve your goals.

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.goal: Transform the weight loss journey into a game, helping users build healthy habits through challenges, social interaction, and rewards.
users: Individuals who want to lose weight but lack motivation
People who enjoy social interaction and need encouragement from peers
Users who are fond of gamified challenges
features: Challenge System (Personal trials, friend challenges, progress tracking, completion rewards)
Social System (Friends, activity sharing, likes and interactions, real-time notifications)
Shop System (Virtual currency 'bagel', avatar customization, challenge templates)
Gamification Elements (Achievement badges, leaderboards, progress bars)
Data Tracking (GA4, Investor Dashboard, proprietary data system)

implementation.title: Frontend Implementation (Why these tools)
stack: React 19 + TypeScript → Scalable SPA with type safety
React Router DOM 7 → Manage complex navigation cleanly
Redux Toolkit + React Query → Separation of client state & server state for challenges, social, and purchases
Tailwind + shadcn/ui + Radix → Efficient UI building with consistency
GSAP + Lottie → Smooth animations for gamified experience
Playwright → E2E tests to ensure purchase & challenge stability

items.title: Backend delays → Self-learned Supabase
solution: Backend engineer was behind schedule → I self-learned Supabase from scratch
Designed 50+ APIs (users, friends, posts, purchases)
Implemented Supabase Auth, Realtime, Storage for seamless interactions

items.title: Safari doesn’t support WebM animation
solution: Original design used WebM sequences, Safari couldn’t render
Solution: fallback to WebP sequences for cross-browser compatibility

items.title: Complex state management
solution: Challenges, social posts, and shop transactions required nested props
Solution: Redux Toolkit for global UI state, React Query for API cache & error handling

items.title: Animation performance optimization
solution: GSAP animations dropped frames under load
Solution: optimized with timeline sequencing to minimize parallel execution

outcomes.title: Outcomes
items: Demo Day: highly positive audience feedback, described as 'as addictive as playing a game'
Showcased problem-solving and adaptability: self-learning backend, handling cross-browser issues, optimizing animations
Proved ability to contribute as more than a UI implementer → capable of driving a full project to completion

implementation.title: Project Management & Planning
stack: Authored 20+ user stories to define MVP and feature requirements.
Prioritized the development roadmap and established a Notion project board to track progress.
Designed software architecture using wireframes, flowcharts, and swimlane diagrams.
Coordinated with the frontend team to document JSON data structures for seamless API integration.

items.title: Backend Development Delays
solution: Identified backend delay risks mid-project, proactively intervened in Supabase development, and coordinated the frontend team to prevent project stalls.

items.title: Ensuring Product Quality
solution: Orchestrated user testing with 20+ testers, conducting 3 iteration cycles to optimize navigation, animations, and calendar displays based on feedback.

items.title: Scope & Resource Management
solution: Flexibly adjusted project scope based on continuous resource assessment, ensuring 100% on-time delivery of core features.

outcomes.title: Project Outcomes
items: Achieved 100% delivery of the gamified weight-loss platform, with testers rating it as 'exceeding bootcamp standards.'
Received unanimous acclaim at the final product demo for its quality and engaging user experience.
Successfully prevented project delays through proactive risk management and cross-functional coordination.
Demonstrated leadership in product strategy, project planning, and quality assurance.

implementation.title: Design & Prototyping
stack: Figma → For creating high-fidelity mockups, interactive prototypes, and a complete design system.
Lottie & After Effects → For designing and exporting complex animations that render smoothly on the web.
Spline → For developing 3D interactive elements for the homepage to create an immersive experience.
Material Design Principles → Applied established design principles to ensure the interface was intuitive and user-friendly.
User Journey Mapping → To visualize user flows, identify pain points, and optimize the experience.

items.title: Translating Gamification Concepts into UI
solution: Designed a system of badges, progress bars, and celebratory animations to visually represent user achievements and maintain motivation.

items.title: Cross-Platform Animation Consistency
solution: Initially used WebM, but discovered it was not supported on Safari. Switched to a WebP sequence as a fallback to ensure a consistent animated experience for all users.

items.title: Maintaining Design System Integrity
solution: Developed a shared Figma library for components, colors, and typography, enabling the frontend team to implement designs with 1:1 accuracy.

outcomes.title: Design Outcomes
items: Created a visually stunning and cohesive UI that was praised as 'addictive' and 'game-like.'
The design system streamlined the development process and ensured a consistent user experience across the platform.
Successfully integrated motion design to enhance user engagement and provide clear feedback.
The final product stands as a testament to design-driven development, where user experience was central to the platform's success.

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.goal: To create a responsive official website that combines brand image with actual booking functionality, enhancing the hotel's digital marketing capabilities.
users: Travelers who need to quickly check hotel information and room types
Consumers who prefer to complete booking and payment processes online
Target customers who want a consistent brand style experience
features: Responsive Design → Consistent experience on mobile, tablet, and desktop
Membership System (Registration / Login / Profile Management)
Booking System (Room browsing, date selection, order creation)
Real-time API Integration → Ensures room availability and price data are up-to-date
Brand Visual Design → Consistent communication of brand value through images, fonts, and colors

implementation.title: Frontend Implementation (Why this choice)
stack: React + TypeScript → Ensures code maintainability and type safety
Tailwind → Quickly builds UI that matches the brand design
Restful API → Connects member, order, and booking data with flexibility
MongoDB Atlas + dbGate + Postman → Backend data storage and testing
Vercel → Fast deployment with CI/CD capabilities

items.title: Complex Booking Process
solution: Initially planned a simple form, but it couldn't handle multiple room types and date conflicts
Solution: Designed an order model to support multiple room selections and dynamic validation

items.title: Brand Design Consistency
solution: Different pages developed by different modules could easily lead to UI inconsistencies
Solution: Created a custom Tailwind theme + component library to ensure design uniformity

outcomes.title: Outcomes
items: Successfully completed a demo of an official website with full booking functionality
Improved understanding of full-stack development: frontend UI, backend data integration, and database operations
Demonstrated independent development capabilities, able to build brand image and business logic from scratch

implementation.title: Design & Prototyping
stack: Figma: Designed high-fidelity UI mockups and responsive layouts.
Design System: Established uniform colors, typography, spacing, and components to ensure brand consistency.
User Flow Analysis: Mapped the booking process to simplify the user journey.

items.title: Maintaining a clean interface during a complex booking process
solution: Broke the process into multiple steps with clear visual guidance.

items.title: Ensuring visual consistency across different devices
solution: Adopted a Mobile-First design strategy and created prototypes for multiple breakpoints in Figma.

outcomes.title: Design Outcomes
items: Designed a brand website that is both aesthetically pleasing and practical, enhancing the hotel's professional image.
The simplified booking flow design lowered the barrier to entry for users, helping to increase conversion rates.
The established design system laid an efficient foundation for future feature expansion.

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.goal: To create a personal portfolio that showcases technical skills and design sense, packaging my diverse talents into a blind box toy concept, and leaving a deep impression on recruiters through narrative visuals during their browsing experience.
users: Recruiters for frontend or software development positions
Users who expect interactive web pages with a sense of design
Overseas or international teams that require a multilingual interface
features: SEO Optimization → Makes the portfolio easily discoverable by search engines
Interactive Animations (GSAP narrative experience, scroll-triggered)
Multilingual Support (English / Chinese switching)
Project Showcase (including technical descriptions and challenge solutions)
Responsive Design → Smooth experience on mobile devices

implementation.title: Frontend Implementation
stack: Next.js 14 → Supports SSG/SSR, balancing performance and SEO
Tailwind + shadcn/ui → Rapidly develops UI while maintaining consistency
GSAP → Creates smooth scrolling animations and a sense of narrative
next-intl → Establishes multilingual switching (Chinese/English)
Vercel → Global deployment, ensuring fast access for visitors

items.title: Balancing SEO and Animation
solution: Excessive animation can affect SEO and performance
Solution: SSR for basic page content, with animation used only as an enhancement

items.title: Multilingual Maintenance
solution: Initial text was hard-coded, making maintenance difficult
Solution: Introduced i18n json files for management, allowing for quick translation updates

outcomes.title: Outcomes
items: The portfolio successfully led to interview invitations in the overseas recruitment process
Demonstrated multilingual development, animation performance, and SEO technical skills
Proved the ability to combine technology, design, and narrative to create memorable products

implementation.title: Design & Prototyping
stack: Figma: Used for UI design, prototyping, and design system management.
Spline & Lottie: Created 3D interactions and 2D animations to add playfulness to the page.
Narrative Design: Packaged the portfolio into a blind box toy concept to guide users through an unboxing exploration.

items.title: Presenting diverse projects and skills within limited screen space
solution: Designed switchable roles (Frontend, UI, PM), with each role corresponding to a different display of projects and skills.

items.title: Balancing visual creativity with a smooth user experience
solution: Adopted scroll-triggered animations to let users experience the story naturally while browsing, rather than being interrupted by mandatory animations.

outcomes.title: Design Outcomes
items: Successfully created a personal website with a strong brand identity, effectively communicating my design philosophy and technical abilities.
The unique blind box concept and interactive design received positive feedback during the recruitment process and increased interview opportunities.
Demonstrated the ability to combine user experience, visual design, and frontend technology to create immersive digital products.

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.goal: Transform Taipei Metro daily commutes into interactive urban adventures and cultural explorations. Through AI-powered companionship, immersive navigation, and collectible card systems, every ride becomes an engaging, explorable, and memorable innovative experience.
users: First-time visitors to Taipei who need route navigation and landmark guidance
Young audiences who love cute IPs, collecting achievements, and nurturing companionship
Daily commuters seeking efficiency and convenience while adding fun to their routine
features: Smart Route Recommendation System (AI voice input, optimal route generation, accessibility options, transfer preferences, time-based planning)
Personalized Companion System (exclusive smart travel buddy, avatar generation, real-time transfer reminders, contextual interactions)
Immersive Interactive Map (dynamic character movement, station cultural navigation, attraction & food recommendations, platform & exit information)
Metro Cultural Card Collection System (station-exclusive cards, gacha game mechanics, rarity tiers, card album collection, metro points rewards)
Trip Records & Ticket Management (automatic trip logging, integrated card top-up, T-Pass purchase, achievement wall & progress charts)

implementation.title: Design Methods & Tools
stack: User Research: Qualitative interviews, Persona modeling, User Journey Map
Prototyping Tools: Figma / Sketch
Design System: Established design specifications including colors, fonts, and components to ensure cross-functional consistency
Collaboration: Cross-functional teamwork (frontend engineers, product managers, AI illustrators)

items.title: User Research & Needs Analysis
solution: Conducted qualitative interviews to identify the pain points of three target groups (tourists, collectors, commuters), discovering that the existing metro app lacked interactivity and cultural connection.

items.title: Experience Design & Information Architecture
solution: Designed a complete user journey with five functional modules: Smart Route Recommendation → Personalized Companion System → Immersive Interactive Map → Cultural Card Collection → Ride History Management, ensuring a smooth experience from inquiry to review.

items.title: AI-Integrated Interface Design
solution: Designed an AI voice input interface and smart recommendation system supporting multi-dimensional route preferences (accessibility, fewest transfers, time selection) to improve usability for disadvantaged groups.

items.title: Gamification Design Strategy
solution: Applied principles of behavioral psychology (completion bias, scarcity effect, social demonstration motivation) to design a station-limited virtual card system, integrating reward mechanisms (metro point redemption, achievement system) to increase user stickiness.

items.title: Visual Design & Brand Shaping
solution: Created a 'Smart Little Companion' character system and designed card visuals that blend personal image with local culture to establish a cute, warm, and intelligent brand identity.

items.title: Interactive Prototype Development
solution: Developed an immersive dynamic map prototype integrating real-time transfer reminders, cultural tour audio, and AR guidance elements to create an RPG-like exploration experience.

items.title: Accessibility Design Implementation
solution: Planned features such as elevator-priority routes, suitable car recommendations, and exit guidance to ensure a friendly experience for users with mobility impairments and those with large luggage.

items.title: Data-Driven Design
solution: Integrated Taipei Metro's open data platform (timetables, crowding levels, exit information) to design data visualizations that support real-time decision-making.

outcomes.title: Impact & Business Value
items: Created a dual user motivation combining utilitarian value (redemption for discounts) and hedonic value (collection fun).
Designed a system with business expansion potential: supporting integration with shopping districts, IP licensing cooperation, and T-Pass promotion.
Enhanced the public transportation experience, promoting cultural tourism and local connection.
